 ‚Äî General Commander of the YPG Sipan Hamo:  Israel is a powerful state in the region, and we hope that the stance it has taken to protect the Druze will also be extended to include the Kurds.

Who could've seen that coming 
üòÅ

The U.S. is getting a lot of wins in the Middle East right now...
- They abandoned the SDF in favour of a stronger, more stable STG, who can now control and administer oil and gas fields, and further counter Iranian influence in the region.
- Because of this agreement with the SDF, the STG will likely go after Druze factions in Suweida next, namely the SMC, which will prevent the STG from normalising ties with Israel, providing Israel with "justification" to keep expanding their "buffer zone", further strengthening their influence and weakening STG potential.
- The more "extreme" Kurdish groups opposed to the agreement with the STG may also turn to Israel, seeking SMC-like relations and support, providing Israel with additional "justification" to stay at odds with the STG, thereby preventing them from getting too strong and keeping them loyal to the US.
- And all the while, the U.S. can continue their efforts at dismantling the Iranian regime, which could end through additional military operations. 
Essentially, a more complex and proxy-based version of "divide and rule". The next few months will be very interesting.

Vuhledar in 2026. 
Population: 25
The city is now around 50 km behind the frontline.

Large numbers of Russian Geran-2 and Gerbera drones are arriving at various airbases in preparation for large attacks on Ukraine.
- Several IL-76MD cargo planes landed at Baltimore Airbase, Voronezh Oblast, with drones being delivered to launch sites (presumably including Tsumublova Testing Ground, Oryol Oblast) via rail.
- An IL-76MD landed at Shatalovo Airbase, Smolensk Obalst, delivering drones to the launch site there.
- An IL-76MD landed at Hvardiiske Airbase, Crimea, delivering drones to the launch site there.

An IL-76MD cargo plane landed at Akhtubinsk Airbase, Astrakhan Oblast during the day.
The cargo presumably consists of Kh-59/69 cruise missiles for the Su-57 fighters stationed there.

Explosions in Dnipro. Cause unknown, possibly a missile. There was also an explosion in Zaporizhzhia.
Clarifying.
Explosions in Dnipro. Cause unknown, possibly a missile. There was also an explosion in Zaporizhzhia.  Clarifying.

Zaporizhzhia City is being targeted by Tornado-S rockets equipped with cluster warheads, which were launched from the Tokmak area of Zaporizhzhia Oblast. At least three impacts have been recorded, 2 of which struck the southern part of the city while the third hit the southern outskirts/nearby settlements. A Russian reconnaissance drone is operating in the area, adjusting the strikes.
The explosion heard in Dnipro is from a Geran-2 drone strike on the Stara Ihren District in the southeastern part of the city. Several more drones are now flying in.

A bunch of Ukrainian accounts are fabricating a Ukrainian HIMARS attack on a substation in Donetsk City.
This has not happened, and the photos being spread are old and unrelated. As of now, only UAVs have attacked the city.

Russia's Rubicon unit has published new footage showing a series of drone strikes on rear Ukrainian targets.
Targets hit include:
- A 19Zh6 radar + a trailer in Mykolaiv Oblast (47.07939, 32.09680), ~62 km from the frontline.
- A 36D6 radar in Dnipropetrovsk Oblast (48.40642, 35.73496), ~63 km from the frontline.
- A 36D6 radar in Dnipropetrovsk Oblast (48.42119, 35.82679), ~62 km from the frontline.
- A 36D6 radar in Dnipropetrovsk Oblast (48.80733, 35.38527), ~114 km from the frontline.
- A P-18 radar in Dnipropetrovsk Oblast (48.81586, 35.75437), ~101 km from the frontline.
- A P-18MU radar + a truck in Mykolaiv Oblast (46.97961, 31.70417), ~47 km from the frontline.
- Command and control vehicle for a P-18MA radar in Mykolaiv Oblast (47.22859, 32.542), ~63 km from the frontline.
- Command and control vehicle for a 36D6 radar in Odesa Oblast (46.60873, 30.91776), ~45 km from the frontline.
- A 36D6 radar in Kharkiv Oblast (49.40271, 36.61234), ~75 km from the frontline.
- A Buk Surface-to-air missile system in Dnipropetrovsk Oblast (48.3567, 36.24613), ~38 km from the frontline.
- 4 strikes on the "Hirnyk" 35 kV electrical substation in Donetsk Oblast (48.58938, 37.48830), ~8 km from the frontline.
Iskander on Kharkiv Oblast from Kursk
Iskander on Kharkiv Oblast from Kursk
Disappeared near Zolochiv, Kharkiv Oblast.
An explosion was heard in the town of Zolochiv.
An explosion was heard in the town of Zolochiv.
The impact occurred outside Zolochiv. Another missile is flying in that direction.
The impact occurred outside Zolochiv. Another missile is flying in that direction.
Another explosion in Zolochiv, impacting the same target.

Four Russian Tornado-S rockets impacted the "Kharkivska" 330 kV electrical substation in the Slobidskyi District of Kharkiv City. Strong explosions were heard and a large fire subsequently broke out.
Coordinates: 49.961754, 36.280484

Four Russian Tornado-S rockets impacted the "Kharkivska" 330 kV electrical substation in the Slobidskyi District of Kharkiv City. Strong explosions were heard and a large fire subsequently broke out.
Coordinates: 49.961754, 36.280484

DTEK, Ukraine's largest private investor in the energy sector, published photos claiming to show damage to a substation in Odesa City following Russian Geran-2 drone strikes overnight. 
However, the photos turned out to be edited screenshots from an older video of theirs showing damage to the Artsyz substation in Artsyz, Odesa Oblast, after it was attacked by missiles and drones on December 18, 2025. 
Geran strikes were indeed carried out on energy infrastructure in Odesa City last night, but these images do not show the damage from this.

Overnight, a Russian Geran-2 drone struck the railway bridge in the town of Vasylkivka, Dnipropetrovsk Oblast.
The drone was equipped with a phosphorus warhead, which resulted in a fire breaking out that burned for over 3 hours, melting the metal of the bridge.
Since then, at least 2 more Geran strikes have been carried out on a different target in Vasylkivka. 
Bridge coordinates: 48.20796, 36.00145

Syrian Government Forces Attack To Free ISIS Detainees In Raqqa Day After Deal With Kurds (Videos)
The forces of the Islamist-led Syrian Transitional Government (STG) attacked a facility where ISIS detainees are kept close to the northern city of Raqqa on January 19, just a day after signing a new merger agreement with the Kurdish-led Syrian Democratic Forces (SDF).
The Kurdish ANHA news agency reported that ‚Äútransitional government mercenaries‚Äù attacked al-Aqttan Prison.
 Meanwhile, the SDF described the attack in a statement as a ‚Äúvery dangerous‚Äù development.
‚ÄúWe affirm the public that the level of threat is escalating significantly, given the attempts by these factions to reach and control the prison, and the serious security repercussions that may result, threatening stability and opening the way for the return of chaos and terrorism,‚Äù the group said.
STG forces entered Raqqa a day earlier. Clashes there continued even after the Syrian President announced the agreement with SDF.
Read more 
HERE

Iran Warns U.S. Against Targeting Supreme Leader As Trump Calls For Change In Country's Leadership 
Iran‚Äôs President Masoud Pezeshkian on January 18 warned the United States against targeting Ali Khamenei, the Supreme Leader of the Islamic Republic.
The warning came amid heightened tensions between the two countries over violent protests in Iran, with President Donald Trump threatening to attack the Islamic Republic earlier in the month if protesters are killed.
Thousands from both sides have been already killed, but the exact death toll remains unclear due to an internet blackout. 
In a post to X, Pezeshkian said: ‚ÄúAn attack on the great leader of our country [Supreme Leader Ali Khamenei] is tantamount to a full-scale war with the Iranian nation.‚Äù
Read more 
HERE

Kurdish Forces Say Al-Hasakah Prison With ‚ÄòThousands' Of ISIS Detainees Is Out Of Control (Videos)
The Syrian Democratic Forces (SDF) said on January 19 that it has lost control of a prison with thousands of ISIS detainees in the northeastern Syrian governorate of al-Hasakah after a wave of attacks by ‚Äú factions‚Äù to the Islamist-led Syrian Transitional Government (STG).
In a statement, the Kurdish-led group said that its fighters repelled several attacks on the prison, located near the town of al-Shaddadi in the southern al-Hasakah countryside, but lost control after sustaining losses.
‚ÄúAlthough Al-Shaddadi Prison is located approximately two kilometers from the International Coalition base in the area, the base did not intervene, despite repeated calls for intervention,‚Äù the group added.
As the prison was under attack, the state-run SANA news agency reported that STG forces had deployed around the city of al-Hasakah.
Read more 
HERE

Words vs. Reality: The Unbridgeable Gap in Ukraine's Mobilization 'Reform'
After taking office as head of the Ukrainian president's office, Kirill Budanov, the former military intelligence chief, held a meeting where he announced his intention to address the issue of mobilization. Many trusting Ukrainian citizens at the time thought that the new head of the office would finally put an end to the lawlessness of the Territorial Recruitment Centers (TRCs) and ensure that mobilization activities complied with the law.
In reality, however, the opposite turned out to be true. The TRCs became more brazen, detentions became harsher, and various means, including gas canisters, were often used against concerned citizens. Ukrainian public forums have seen a significant increase in footage of forced mobilization, which Ukrainian officials have once again called Russian information operations (IPSO) generated by neural networks.
üëâ
 Read more 
HERE

Russian Army Advances Near Kostiantynivka And Approaches Orikhiv (Videos)
On January 19, the Russian military advanced near the city of Kostiantynivka in Donetsk and approached the city of Orikhiv in Zaporizhzhia.
In Donetsk, the Tsentr [Center] Group of Forces captured Novopavlovka, which is located to the northwest of Kostiantynivka, according to the Russian Ministry of Defense. The capture of the settlement marked the first Russian push in this area in a long time.
Meanwhile far to the west in Zaporizhzhia, the Russian MoD reported that the Vostok [East] Group of Forces had captured Pavlivka, which was located to the east of Stepnohirsk.
Read more 
HERE
